name: Ncs
body:
### Welcome to Nodecast server.
Nodecast is a worker scheduler, also he's agnoctic so yours workers can use any kind of langage. Workers must read STDIN to receive a payload and write to STDOUT to push a payload.
Your worker is managed with [NCW](http://nodecast.github.com/ncw/) (nodecast client) which is connected to NCS.
Nodecast can push any kind of binary data to a worker or to a pool of worker.

Nodecast is using deeply [Zeromq](http://www.zeromq.org/) to communicate between yours workers and [mongoDB](http://www.mongodb.org/) to store yours payloads and the workers's status.

### FUTUR
Nodecast embeds an XMPP server and soon a torrent tracker. These features will be explains later.

The next big step is to embeds a web interface to manage yours workers, kwow their status, etc ...

### TECH
Nodecast is using a full Qt stack (C++) so he has a tiny memory print and he is really quickly to perform yours tasks. 

[This picture](https://raw.github.com/nodecast/ncs/master/docs/ncs_dev.png) is showing the internal architecture, it's only for developers.

![nodecast internal architecture](https://raw.github.com/nodecast/ncs/master/docs/ncs_dev.png)

Picture of nodecast for a user

![nodecast user's architecture](https://raw.github.com/nodecast/ncs/master/docs/ncs_user.png)

### Launch NCS

```
$ ncs --mongodb-ip=127.0.0.1 --mongodb-base=nodecast_prod --domain-name=localhost --xmpp-client-port=6222 --xmpp-server-port=6269 --smtp-hostname="your.server.mail" --smtp-username="your-user-account" --smtp-password="your-password" --smtp-sender="your-email-sender" --smtp-recipient="your-email-recipient"
```

Nodecast can use smtp protocol to send an email alert when a worker is down.
